headline.main: NER-YORK CITY.; Cadictment of the Mayor and Members of the Board of Councilmen.. THE LIQUOR TRAFFIC. The Park Street-Preaching. American Settlement Company. Moriality of the City. Run Down by a Steamer. Suicide by Hanging. Assault in Broadway. More Use of the Knife. Suicide by Shooting. Launch of the Aarora. Arraignment of Murderers.

docs.lead_paragraph: During the recent session of the Grand Jury, 1,514 true bills of indictment were returned, of which 1,113 were for violations of the Liquor Law. Among those indicated are JACOB A. WESTERVELT, Mayor, and NATHANIEL ROE and JOHN G. SEELEY, members of the Board of Councilmen. Councilman ROE is charged with granting a license to MARY MCNIGHT, an alien, residing at No. 88 Varick-street, in the Eighth Ward.

headline.main: CHINA.; PLAIN TALK AND SPICY COMMENTS, Documentary History of the Chinese Commission. Humphrey Marshall, The Shanghai Merchants, Commodere Perry, Peter Parker, and others, in Collision. DIPLOMATIC CORRESPONDENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: On the 3d day of February last we published a statement relative to a misunderstanding between Hon. HUMPHREY MARSHALL, United States Commissioner to China, and the American merchants at Shanghai, relative to the of collection of duties during the time when Shanghai was threatened by the Rebels or in their hands, and the revenue officers of the Empie had abandoned their posts.

headline.main: ENGLAND.; The War News--Spain and denie--Archdeacon Walberfarce--Priaco Athert and Nupolean--The ?? London.

docs.lead_paragraph: At last all the world, an I especially this Metropolitan world, believes that the long talked of expedition against Sebastopol is no longer a "myth," but a downright up and go at 'em fight.

headline.main: CITY FINANCES.; Annual Report of the Comptroller.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following Report was received by the Roard of Aldermen of Thursday night, and ordered to be printed: FINANCE DEPARTMENT, COMPTROLLER'S Office, No. 5 Hall of Records, New - York, Sept. 21, 1854.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. Board of Aldermen Deaf Muto Marriage. Yellow Fever at Sea. Funeral of Dr. Swett. Illness of Rev. Dr. Lewis. Slave Trade out of the Port of New-York. Kausas Emigrants. Board of Supervisors. The Bank Forgeries. LAW INTELLIGENCE, COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President, NATHAN C. ELY, presiding. After the usual preliminaries, the Board proceeded to the transaction of business. THE NEW CITY HALL. The following communication from John McKeon, Esq., United States District Attorney, to the Mayor, was received by the Board and referred to a Special Committee.
